# Linux commands

## File/Directory Command

- [ls](./man/ls.md) shows the list of files and directories in the specific directory

```
 $ ls
```

- [cd](./man/cd.md) changes the directory

```
 $ cd ~
```

- [pwd](./man/pwd.md) shows current path/directory

```
 $ pwd
```

- [mkdir](./man/mkdir.md) creating a directory.

```
 $ mkdir helloYonsei
```
- [rmdir](./man/rmdir.md) removing a directory.

```
 $ rmdir helloYonsei
```

- [echo](./man/echo.md) print blah ... blah ...

```
 $ echo $HOME > myHomeDir.txt
```

- [cat](./man/cat.md)

```
 $ cat myHomeDir.txt
```

- [rm](./man/rm.md) delete file

```
 rm myHomeDir.txt
```

- [cp](./man/cp.md) copy file file A to file B.

```
 cp A B
```
- [mv](./man/mv.md) rename or move file A to file B

```
 mv A B
```

- [ln] create symbolic link and link it to file.

```
 ln -s A B
```
